Bibliographic metadata.Title: Mineral prospecting mapping with conditional generative adversarial network augmented data
Bibliographic metadata.Author: Yixiao Wu, Bingli Liu, Yaxin Gao, Cheng Li, Rui Tang, Yunhui Kong, Miao Xie, Kangning Li, Shiyao Dan, Ke Qi, Yufei Ren, Zhuo Wu

Abstract: Mineral Prospectivity Mapping (MPM) plays a pivotal role in identifying geo-anomalies indicative of potential mineralization, utilizing various geological, geophysical, geochemical, and remote sensing data. This study proposes a Conditional Generative Adversarial Network (cGAN) strategy for data augmentation to address challenges posed by limited geological exploration data. The results indicate that the cGAN-based data augmentation strategy exhibits higher resistance to overfitting, successfully delineating a prospectivity map for gold deposits in the Hezuo-Meiwu district, Gansu, China.
Methodology: supervised > deep learning > convolutional neural network (CNN); supervised > deep learning > GAN; supervised > deep learning > CNN–GAN hybrid
Key points: Proposes a cGAN strategy for data augmentation in mineral prospectivity mapping.
Demonstrates improved performance and reduced overfitting compared to traditional methods.
Successfully delineates a prospectivity map for gold deposits in the Hezuo-Meiwu district.
Utilizes a combination of geological, geophysical, and geochemical data for analysis.
